DESCRIPTOR.LABEL: GSC MIxS Food and Production
DESCRIPTOR.NAME: GSC MIxS Food and Production
DESCRIPTOR.DESCRIPTION: Genomic Standards Consortium package extension for reporting of measurements and observations obtained from the environment where the sample was obtained. By choosing the environmental package, a selection of fields can be made from a relevant subsets of the GSC terms. This package is a combination of the four food extensions (MIxS-food-animal and animal feed, MIxS-food-farm environment, MIxS-food-food production facility, MIxS-food-human foods).

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: investigation and results

FIELD.LABEL: culture result
FIELD.NAME: culture result
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Any result of a bacterial culture experiment reported as a binary assessment such as positive/negative, active/inactive.

FIELD.LABEL: culture result organism
FIELD.NAME: culture result organism
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Taxonomic information about the cultured organism(s).

FIELD.LABEL: culture target microbial analyte
FIELD.NAME: culture target microbial analyte
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The target microbial analyte in terms of investigation scope. This field accepts terms under organism (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C14250). This field also accepts identification numbers from NCBI under https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/taxonomy.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: investigation experiment design

FIELD.LABEL: biological sample replicate
FIELD.NAME: biological sample replicate
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Measurements of biologically distinct samples that show biological variation.

FIELD.LABEL: technical sample replicate
FIELD.NAME: technical sample replicate
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Repeated measurements of the same sample that show independent measures of the noise associated with the equipment and the protocols.

FIELD.LABEL: purpose of sampling
FIELD.NAME: purpose of sampling
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The reason that the sample was collected.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Organism characteristics: ecosystem
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: ecosystem and relationships ( Organism characteristics got too big)

FIELD.LABEL: trophic level
FIELD.NAME: trophic level
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Trophic levels are the feeding position in a food chain. Microbes can be a range of producers (e.g. chemolithotroph)

FIELD.LABEL: observed biotic relationship
FIELD.NAME: observed biotic relationship
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Description of relationship(s) between the subject organism and other organism(s) it is associated with. E.g., parasite on species X; mutualist with species Y. The target organism is the subject of the relationship, and the other organism(s) is the object.

FIELD.LABEL: known pathogenicity
FIELD.NAME: known pathogenicity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: To what is the entity pathogenic, for instance plant, fungi, bacteria

FIELD.LABEL: relationship to oxygen
FIELD.NAME: relationship to oxygen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Is this organism an aerobe, anaerobe? Please note that aerobic and anaerobic are valid descriptors for microbial environments

FIELD.LABEL: propagation
FIELD.NAME: propagation
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The type of reproduction from the parent stock. Values for this field is specific to different taxa. For phage or virus: lytic/lysogenic/temperate/obligately lytic. For plasmids: incompatibility group. For eukaryotes: sexual/asexual. Mandatory for MIGs of eukayotes, plasmids and viruses.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: sample collection: methods, storage and transport
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: sample collection: methods, storage and transport (sample collection became unmanageable)

FIELD.LABEL: sample transportation temperature
FIELD.NAME: sample transportation temperature
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Temperature at which sample was transported, e.g. -20 or 4 degree Celsius.

FIELD.LABEL: sample transport container
FIELD.NAME: sample transport container
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Container in which the sample was stored during transport. Indicate the location name.

FIELD.LABEL: sample transport duration
FIELD.NAME: sample transport duration
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The duration of time from when the sample was collected until processed. Indicate the duration for which the sample was stored written in ISO 8601 format.

FIELD.LABEL: sample collection device
FIELD.NAME: sample collection device
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The device used to collect an environmental sample. It is recommended to use terms listed under environmental sampling device (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO) and/or terms listed under specimen collection device (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/GENEPIO_0002094).

FIELD.LABEL: sample collection method
FIELD.NAME: sample collection method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The method employed for collecting the sample. Can be provided in the form of a PMID, DOI, url or text.

FIELD.LABEL: sample storage temperature
FIELD.NAME: sample storage temperature
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: temperature at which sample was stored, e.g. -80

FIELD.LABEL: sample storage device
FIELD.NAME: sample storage device
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The container used to store the sample. This field accepts terms listed under container (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C43186). If the proper descriptor is not listed please use text to describe the storage device.

FIELD.LABEL: sample storage location
FIELD.NAME: sample storage location
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Location at which sample was stored, usually name of a specific freezer/room. Indicate the location name.

FIELD.LABEL: size-fraction lower threshold
FIELD.NAME: size-fraction lower threshold
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Refers to the mesh/pore size used to retain the sample. Materials smaller than the size threshold are excluded from the sample

FIELD.LABEL: size-fraction upper threshold
FIELD.NAME: size-fraction upper threshold
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Refers to the mesh/pore size used to pre-filter/pre-sort the sample. Materials larger than the size threshold are excluded from the sample

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: local environment conditions: soil
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: local environment conditions: soil (as local environment conditions grew too large)

FIELD.LABEL: soil type
FIELD.NAME: soil type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Description of the soil type or classification. This field accepts terms under soil (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00001998). Multiple terms can be separated by pipes.

FIELD.LABEL: soil type method
FIELD.NAME: soil type method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: reference or method used in determining soil series name or other lower-level classification

FIELD.LABEL: soil texture method
FIELD.NAME: soil texture method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: reference or method used in determining soil texture

FIELD.LABEL: soil pH
FIELD.NAME: soil pH
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: pH measurement of the soil; e.g. 6.2

FIELD.LABEL: soil cover
FIELD.NAME: soil cover
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Description of the material covering the sampled soil. This field accepts terms under ENVO:00010483, environmental material.

FIELD.LABEL: soil texture classification
FIELD.NAME: soil texture classification
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: One of the 12 soil texture classes use to describe soil texture based on the relative proportion of different grain sizes of mineral particles [sand (50 um to 2 mm), silt (2 um to 50 um), and clay (<2 um)] in a soil.

FIELD.LABEL: soil sediment porosity
FIELD.NAME: soil sediment porosity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Porosity of soil or deposited sediment is volume of voids divided by the total volume of sample.

FIELD.LABEL: soil conductivity
FIELD.NAME: soil conductivity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Conductivity of soil at time of sampling.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: sample collection: site related

FIELD.LABEL: facility type
FIELD.NAME: facility type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Establishment details about the type of facility where the sample was taken. This is independent of the specific product(s) within the facility.

FIELD.LABEL: collection site geographic feature
FIELD.NAME: collection site geographic feature
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Text or terms that describe the geographic feature where the food sample was obtained by the researcher. This field accepts selected terms listed under the following ontologies: anthropogenic geographic feature (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00000002), for example agricultural fairground [ENVO:01000986]; garden [ENVO:00000011} or any of its subclasses; market [ENVO:01000987]; water well [ENVO:01000002]; or human construction (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00000070).

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: sample collection: core sample properties

FIELD.LABEL: area sampled size
FIELD.NAME: area sampled size
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The total amount or size (volume (ml), mass (g) or area (m2) ) of sample collected.

FIELD.LABEL: sample name
FIELD.NAME: sample name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Sample Name is a name that you choose for the sample. It can have any format, but we suggest that you make it concise, unique and consistent within your lab, and as informative as possible. Every Sample Name from a single Submitter must be unique.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: non-sample terms: study or project

FIELD.LABEL: study design
FIELD.NAME: study design
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A plan specification comprised of protocols (which may specify how and what kinds of data will be gathered) that are executed as part of an investigation and is realized during a study design execution. This field accepts terms under study design (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/OBI_0500000). If the proper descriptor is not listed please use text to describe the study design. Multiple terms can be separated by pipes.

FIELD.LABEL: project name
FIELD.NAME: project name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the project within which the sequencing was organized

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: food and agriculture: farm

FIELD.LABEL: farm equipment sanitization
FIELD.NAME: farm equipment sanitization
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Method used to sanitize growing and harvesting equipment. This can including type and concentration of sanitizing solution. Multiple terms can be separated by one or more pipes.

FIELD.LABEL: equipment shared with other farms
FIELD.NAME: equipment shared with other farms
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: List of planting, growing or harvesting equipment shared with other farms. This field accepts terms listed under agricultural implement (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/AGRO_00000416). Multiple terms can be separated by pipes.

FIELD.LABEL: farm equipment used
FIELD.NAME: farm equipment used
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: List of equipment used for planting, fertilization, harvesting, irrigation, land levelling, residue management, weeding or transplanting during the growing season. This field accepts terms listed under agricultural implement (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/AGRO_00000416). Multiple terms can be separated by pipes.

FIELD.LABEL: farm equipment sanitization frequency
FIELD.NAME: farm equipment sanitization frequency
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The number of times farm equipment is cleaned. Frequency of cleaning might be on a Daily basis, Weekly, Monthly, Quarterly or Annually.

FIELD.LABEL: farm watering water source
FIELD.NAME: farm watering water source
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Source of water used on the farm for irrigation of crops or watering of livestock.

FIELD.LABEL: food production system characteristics
FIELD.NAME: food production system characteristics
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Descriptors of the food production system or of the agricultural environment and growing conditions related to the farm production system, such as wild caught, organic, free-range, industrial, dairy, beef, domestic or cultivated food production. This field accepts terms listed under food production (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03530206). Multiple terms may apply and can be separated by pipes.

FIELD.LABEL: animal water delivery method
FIELD.NAME: animal water delivery method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Description of the equipment or method used to distribute water to livestock. This field accepts termed listed under water delivery equipment (http://opendata.inra.fr/EOL/EOL_0001653). Multiple terms can be separated by pipes.

FIELD.LABEL: plant water delivery method
FIELD.NAME: plant water delivery method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Description of the equipment or method used to distribute water to crops. This field accepts termed listed under irrigation process (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/AGRO_00000006). Multiple terms can be separated by pipes.

FIELD.LABEL: food harvesting process
FIELD.NAME: food harvesting process
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A harvesting process is a process which takes in some food material from an individual or community of plant or animal organisms in a given context and time, and outputs a precursor or consumable food product. This may include a part of an organism or the whole, and may involve killing the organism.

FIELD.LABEL: food animal source diet
FIELD.NAME: food animal source diet
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: If the isolate is from a food animal, the type of diet eaten by the food animal. Please list the main food staple and the setting, if appropriate. For a list of acceptable animal feed terms or categories, please see http://www.feedipedia.org. Multiple terms may apply and can be separated by pipes |Food product for animal covers foods intended for consumption by domesticated animals. Consult http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03309997. If the proper descriptor is not listed please use text to describe the food type. Multiple terms can be separated by one or more pipes. If the proper descriptor is not listed please use text to describe the food product type.

FIELD.LABEL: food production characteristics
FIELD.NAME: food production characteristics
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Descriptors of the food production system such as wild caught, free-range, organic, free-range, industrial, dairy, beef.

FIELD.LABEL: food animal group size
FIELD.NAME: food animal group size
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The number of food animals of the same species that are maintained together as a unit, i.e. a herd or flock.

FIELD.LABEL: fertilizer administration date
FIELD.NAME: fertilizer administration date
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Date of administration of soil amendment or fertilizer. Multiple terms may apply and can be separated by pipes, listing in reverse chronological order.

FIELD.LABEL: animal feeding equipment
FIELD.NAME: animal feeding equipment
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Description of the feeding equipment used for livestock. This field accepts terms listed under feed delivery (http://opendata.inra.fr/EOL/EOL_0001757). Multiple terms can be separated by one or more pipes.

FIELD.LABEL: crop yield
FIELD.NAME: crop yield
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Amount of crop produced per unit or area of land.

FIELD.LABEL: water delivery frequency
FIELD.NAME: water delivery frequency
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Number of water delivery events within a given period of time.

FIELD.LABEL: animal housing system
FIELD.NAME: animal housing system
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Description of the housing system of the livestock. This field accepts terms listed under terrestrial management housing system (http://opendata.inra.fr/EOL/EOL_0001605).

FIELD.LABEL: environmental feature adjacent water source
FIELD.NAME: environmental feature adjacent water source
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Description of the environmental features that are adjacent to the farm water source. This field accepts terms under ecosystem (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_01001110) and human construction (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00000070). Multiple terms can be separated by pipes.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: non-sample terms

FIELD.LABEL: ploidy
FIELD.NAME: ploidy
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The ploidy level of the genome (e.g. allopolyploid, haploid, diploid, triploid, tetraploid). It has implications for the downstream study of duplicated gene and regions of the genomes (and perhaps for difficulties in assembly). For terms, please select terms listed under class ploidy (PATO:001374) of Phenotypic Quality Ontology (PATO), and for a browser of PATO (v 2018-03-27) please refer to http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/PATO

FIELD.LABEL: number of replicons
FIELD.NAME: number of replicons
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Reports the number of replicons in a nuclear genome of eukaryotes, in the genome of a bacterium or archaea or the number of segments in a segmented virus. Always applied to the haploid chromosome count of a eukaryote. Mandatory for MIGS of eukaryotes, bacteria, archaea and segmented virus.

FIELD.LABEL: extrachromosomal elements
FIELD.NAME: extrachromosomal elements
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Do plasmids exist of significant phenotypic consequence (e.g. ones that determine virulence or antibiotic resistance). Megaplasmids? Other plasmids (borrelia has 15+ plasmids).

FIELD.LABEL: estimated size
FIELD.NAME: estimated size
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The estimated size of the genome (in bp) prior to sequencing. Of particular importance in the sequencing of (eukaryotic) genome which could remain in draft form for a long or unspecified period. Mandatory for MIGS of eukaryotes.

FIELD.LABEL: target gene
FIELD.NAME: target gene
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Targeted gene or locus name for marker gene studies

FIELD.LABEL: target subfragment
FIELD.NAME: target subfragment
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of subfragment of a gene or locus. Important to e.g. identify special regions on marker genes like V6 on 16S rRNA

FIELD.LABEL: multiplex identifiers
FIELD.NAME: multiplex identifiers
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Molecular barcodes, called Multiplex Identifiers (MIDs), that are used to specifically tag unique samples in a sequencing run. Sequence should be reported in uppercase letters

FIELD.LABEL: sequence quality check
FIELD.NAME: sequence quality check
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Indicate if the sequence has been called by automatic systems (none) or undergone a manual editing procedure (e.g. by inspecting the raw data or chromatograms). Applied only for sequences that are not submitted to SRA or DRA

FIELD.LABEL: chimera check software
FIELD.NAME: chimera check software
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Tool(s) used for chimera checking, including version number and parameters, to discover and remove chimeric sequences. A chimeric sequence is comprised of two or more phylogenetically distinct parent sequences.

FIELD.LABEL: relevant electronic resources
FIELD.NAME: relevant electronic resources
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A related resource that is referenced, cited, or otherwise associated to the sequence in the format of a PMID, DOI or URL

FIELD.LABEL: relevant standard operating procedures
FIELD.NAME: relevant standard operating procedures
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Standard operating procedures used in assembly and/or annotation of genomes, metagenomes or environmental sequences in the format of a PMID, DOI or URL

FIELD.LABEL: 16s recovered
FIELD.NAME: 16s recovered
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Can a 16S gene be recovered from the submitted bin, SAG or MAG?

FIELD.LABEL: 16S recovery software
FIELD.NAME: 16S recovery software
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Tools used for 16S rRNA gene extraction. Add names and versions of software(s), parameters used

FIELD.LABEL: completeness score
FIELD.NAME: completeness score
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Completeness score is typically based on either the fraction of markers found as compared to a database or the percent of a genome found as compared to a closely related reference genome. Completeness score is one of 3 attributes which in combination reflect the standard quality of a MAG, see here for more information: https://ena-docs.readthedocs.io/en/latest/faq_metagenomes.html. Mandatory for all samples directly linked with SAGs or MAGs.

FIELD.LABEL: completeness software
FIELD.NAME: completeness software
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Tools used for completion estimate, i.e. checkm, anvi'o, busco. Mandatory for all samples directly linked with SAGs or MAGs.

FIELD.LABEL: completeness approach
FIELD.NAME: completeness approach
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The approach used to determine the completeness of a given bin, SAG or MAG, which would typically make use of a set of conserved marker genes or a closely related reference genome. For UViG completeness, include reference genome or group used, and contig feature suggesting a complete genome

FIELD.LABEL: assembly quality
FIELD.NAME: assembly quality
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The assembly quality category is based on sets of criteria outlined for each assembly quality category. For MISAG/MIMAG; Finished: Single, validated, contiguous sequence per replicon without gaps or ambiguities with a consensus error rate equivalent to Q50 or better. High Quality Draft:Multiple fragments where gaps span repetitive regions. Presence of the 23S, 16S and 5S rRNA genes and at least 18 tRNAs. Medium Quality Draft:Many fragments with little to no review of assembly other than reporting of standard assembly statistics. Low Quality Draft:Many fragments with little to no review of assembly other than reporting of standard assembly statistics. Assembly statistics include, but are not limited to total assembly size, number of contigs, contig N50/L50, and maximum contig length. For MIUVIG; Finished: Single, validated, contiguous sequence per replicon without gaps or ambiguities, with extensive manual review and editing to annotate putative gene functions and transcriptional units. High-quality draft genome: One or multiple fragments, totaling ≥ 90% of the expected genome or replicon sequence or predicted complete. Genome fragment(s): One or multiple fragments, totalling < 90% of the expected genome or replicon sequence, or for which no genome size could be estimated.

TEXT_VALUE.VALUE: Many fragments with little to no review of assembly other than reporting of standard assembly statistics
Multiple fragments where gaps span repetitive regions. Presence of the 23S, 16S, and 5S rRNA genes and at least 18 tRNAs
Single contiguous sequence without gaps or ambiguities with a consensus error rate equivalent to Q50 or better

FIELD.LABEL: assembly name
FIELD.NAME: assembly name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name/version of the assembly provided by the submitter that is used in the genome browsers and in the community

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Collection event information

FIELD.LABEL: collection date
FIELD.NAME: collection date
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The date the sample was collected with the intention of sequencing, either as an instance (single point in time) or interval. In case no exact time is available, the date/time can be right truncated i.e. all of these are valid ISO8601 compliant times: 2008-01-23T19:23:10+00:00; 2008-01-23T19:23:10; 2008-01-23; 2008-01; 2008.

TEXT_FIELD.REGEX_VALUE: (^[12][0-9]{3}(-(0[1-9]|1[0-2])(-(0[1-9]|[12][0-9]|3[01])(T[0-9]{2}:[0-9]{2}(:[0-9]{2})?Z?([+-][0-9]{1,2})?)?)?)?(/[0-9]{4}(-[0-9]{2}(-[0-9]{2}(T[0-9]{2}:[0-9]{2}(:[0-9]{2})?Z?([+-][0-9]{1,2})?)?)?)?)?$)|(^not collected$)|(^not provided$)|(^restricted access$)|(^missing: control sample$)|(^missing: sample group$)|(^missing: synthetic construct$)|(^missing: lab stock$)|(^missing: third party data$)|(^missing: data agreement established pre-2023$)|(^missing: endangered species$)|(^missing: human-identifiable$)

FIELD.LABEL: altitude
FIELD.NAME: altitude
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The altitude of the sample is the vertical distance between Earth's surface above Sea Level and the sampled position in the air.

TEXT_FIELD.REGEX_VALUE: ((0|((0\.)|([1-9][0-9]*\.?))[0-9]*)([Ee][+-]?[0-9]+)?)|((^not collected$)|(^not provided$)|(^restricted access$)|(^missing: control sample$)|(^missing: sample group$)|(^missing: synthetic construct$)|(^missing: lab stock$)|(^missing: third party data$)|(^missing: data agreement established pre-2023$)|(^missing: endangered species$)|(^missing: human-identifiable$))

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (country and/or sea)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (country and/or sea)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of where the sample was collected from, with the intention of sequencing, as defined by the country or sea name. Country or sea names should be chosen from the INSDC country list (http://insdc.org/country.html).

TEXT_VALUE.VALUE: South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (latitude)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (latitude)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by latitude. The values should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system

TEXT_FIELD.REGEX_VALUE: (^[+-]?[0-9]+.?[0-9]{0,8}$)|(^not collected$)|(^not provided$)|(^restricted access$)|(^missing: control sample$)|(^missing: sample group$)|(^missing: synthetic construct$)|(^missing: lab stock$)|(^missing: third party data$)|(^missing: data agreement established pre-2023$)|(^missing: endangered species$)|(^missing: human-identifiable$)

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (longitude)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (longitude)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by longitude. The values should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system

TEXT_FIELD.REGEX_VALUE: (^[+-]?[0-9]+.?[0-9]{0,8}$)|(^not collected$)|(^not provided$)|(^restricted access$)|(^missing: control sample$)|(^missing: sample group$)|(^missing: synthetic construct$)|(^missing: lab stock$)|(^missing: third party data$)|(^missing: data agreement established pre-2023$)|(^missing: endangered species$)|(^missing: human-identifiable$)

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (region and locality)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (region and locality)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the specific region name followed by the locality name.

FIELD.LABEL: broad-scale environmental context
FIELD.NAME: broad-scale environmental context
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Report the major environmental system the sample or specimen came from. The system(s) identified should have a coarse spatial grain, to provide the general environmental context of where the sampling was done (e.g. in the desert or a rainforest). We recommend using subclasses of EnvO’s biome class: http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00000428. EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS.

FIELD.LABEL: local environmental context
FIELD.NAME: local environmental context
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Report the entity or entities which are in the sample or specimen’s local vicinity and which you believe have significant causal influences on your sample or specimen. We recommend using EnvO terms which are of smaller spatial grain than your entry for "broad-scale environmental context". Terms, such as anatomical sites, from other OBO Library ontologies which interoperate with EnvO (e.g. UBERON) are accepted in this field. EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS.

FIELD.LABEL: environmental medium
FIELD.NAME: environmental medium
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Report the environmental material(s) immediately surrounding the sample or specimen at the time of sampling. We recommend using subclasses of 'environmental material' (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00010483). EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS . Terms from other OBO ontologies are permissible as long as they reference mass/volume nouns (e.g. air, water, blood) and not discrete, countable entities (e.g. a tree, a leaf, a table top).

FIELD.LABEL: elevation
FIELD.NAME: elevation
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The elevation of the sampling site as measured by the vertical distance from mean sea level.

TEXT_FIELD.REGEX_VALUE: ([+-]?(0|((0\.)|([1-9][0-9]*\.?))[0-9]*)([Ee][+-]?[0-9]+)?)|((^not collected$)|(^not provided$)|(^restricted access$)|(^missing: control sample$)|(^missing: sample group$)|(^missing: synthetic construct$)|(^missing: lab stock$)|(^missing: third party data$)|(^missing: data agreement established pre-2023$)|(^missing: endangered species$)|(^missing: human-identifiable$))

FIELD.LABEL: culture isolation date
FIELD.NAME: culture isolation date
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A culture isolation date is a date-time entity marking the end of a process in which a sample yields a positive result for the target microbial analyte(s) in the form of an isolated colony or colonies.

FIELD.LABEL: time course duration
FIELD.NAME: time course duration
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: For time-course research studies involving samples of the food commodity, indicate the total duration of the time-course study.

FIELD.LABEL: number of samples collected
FIELD.NAME: number of samples collected
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The number of samples collected during the current sampling event.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: internal environment

FIELD.LABEL: surface material
FIELD.NAME: surface material
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: surface materials at the point of sampling

FIELD.LABEL: ventilation rate
FIELD.NAME: ventilation rate
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: ventilation rate of the system in the sampled premises

FIELD.LABEL: indoor surface
FIELD.NAME: indoor surface
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: type of indoor surface

FIELD.LABEL: ventilation type
FIELD.NAME: ventilation type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The intentional movement of air from outside a building to the inside through forced or natural movement of air

FIELD.LABEL: sampling room sterilization method
FIELD.NAME: sampling room sterilization method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The method used to sterilize the sampling room. This field accepts terms listed under electromagnetic radiation (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_01001026). If the proper descriptor is not listed, please use text to describe the sampling room sterilization method. Multiple terms can be separated by pipes.

FIELD.LABEL: sampling floor
FIELD.NAME: sampling floor
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The floor of the building, where the sampling room is located

FIELD.LABEL: average daily occupancy
FIELD.NAME: average daily occupancy
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Daily average occupancy of room. Indicate the number of person(s) daily occupying the sampling room.

FIELD.LABEL: sample surface moisture
FIELD.NAME: sample surface moisture
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Degree of water held on a sampled surface. If present, user can state the degree of water held on surface (intermittent moisture, submerged). If no surface moisture is present indicate not present.

FIELD.LABEL: sampling room id or name
FIELD.NAME: sampling room id or name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Explain how and for how long the soil sample was stored before DNA extraction (fresh/frozen/other).

FIELD.LABEL: fermentation relative humidity
FIELD.NAME: fermentation relative humidity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The relative humidity of the fermented food fermentation process.

FIELD.LABEL: room dimensions
FIELD.NAME: room dimensions
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The length, width and height of sampling room

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: sample collection

FIELD.LABEL: amount or size of sample collected
FIELD.NAME: amount or size of sample collected
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The total amount or size (volume (ml), mass (g) or area (m2) ) of sample collected.

FIELD.LABEL: organism count
FIELD.NAME: organism count
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Total cell count of any organism (or group of organisms) per gram, volume or area of sample, should include name of organism followed by count. The method that was used for the enumeration (e.g. qPCR, atp, mpn, etc.) Should also be provided. (example: total prokaryotes; 3.5e7 cells per ml; qpcr)

FIELD.LABEL: sampling time point
FIELD.NAME: sampling time point
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Time point at which a sample or observation is made or taken from a biomaterial as measured from some reference point. Indicate the timepoint written in ISO 8601 format.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Organism characteristics

FIELD.LABEL: growth habit
FIELD.NAME: growth habit
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: characteristic shape, appearance or growth form of a plant species

FIELD.LABEL: sample storage duration
FIELD.NAME: sample storage duration
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Duration for which the sample was stored. Indicate the duration for which the sample was stored written in ISO 8601 format.

FIELD.LABEL: sequencing kit
FIELD.NAME: sequencing kit
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Pre-filled, ready-to-use reagent cartridges. Used to produce improved chemistry, cluster density and read length as well as improve quality (Q) scores. Reagent components are encoded to interact with the sequencing system to validate compatibility with user-defined applications. Indicate name of the sequencing kit.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: host disorder

FIELD.LABEL: host disease status
FIELD.SYNONYM: health or disease status of specific host
FIELD.NAME: host disease status
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: list of diseases with which the host has been diagnosed; can include multiple diagnoses. The value of the field depends on host; for humans the terms should be chosen from DO (Disease Ontology) at http://www.disease-ontology.org, other hosts are free text

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: host description

FIELD.LABEL: host age
FIELD.NAME: host age
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: age of host at the time of sampling; relevant scale depends on species and study, e.g. could be seconds for amoebae or centuries for trees

FIELD.LABEL: host taxid
FIELD.SYNONYM: host of the symbiotic host taxon id
FIELD.NAME: host taxid
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: NCBI taxon id of the host, e.g. 9606

FIELD.LABEL: host height
FIELD.NAME: host height
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: the height of subject

TEXT_FIELD.REGEX_VALUE: ((0|((0\.)|([1-9][0-9]*\.?))[0-9]*)([Ee][+-]?[0-9]+)?)|((^not collected$)|(^not provided$)|(^restricted access$)|(^missing: control sample$)|(^missing: sample group$)|(^missing: synthetic construct$)|(^missing: lab stock$)|(^missing: third party data$)|(^missing: data agreement established pre-2023$)|(^missing: endangered species$)|(^missing: human-identifiable$))

FIELD.LABEL: host length
FIELD.NAME: host length
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: the length of subject

FIELD.LABEL: host total mass
FIELD.NAME: host total mass
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: total mass of the host at collection, the unit depends on host

FIELD.LABEL: host phenotype
FIELD.NAME: host phenotype
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: phenotype of host. For Phenotypic quality Ontology (PATO) (v 2013-10-28) terms, please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/PATO

FIELD.LABEL: host scientific name
FIELD.NAME: host scientific name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Scientific name of the natural (as opposed to laboratory) host to the organism from which sample was obtained.

FIELD.LABEL: host subspecific genetic lineage
FIELD.NAME: host subspecific genetic lineage
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Information about the genetic distinctness of the host organism below the subspecies level e.g., serovar, serotype, biotype, ecotype, variety, cultivar, or any relevant genetic typing schemes like Group I plasmid. Subspecies should not be recorded in this term, but in the NCBI taxonomy. Supply both the lineage name and the lineage rank separated by a colon, e.g., biovar:abc123.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Serology detection

FIELD.LABEL: serovar or serotype
FIELD.NAME: serovar or serotype
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A characterization of a cell or microorganism based on the antigenic properties of the molecules on its surface. Indicate the name of a serovar or serotype of interest. This field accepts terms under organism (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C14250). This field also accepts identification numbers from NCBI under https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/taxonomy.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: local environment conditions

FIELD.LABEL: humidity
FIELD.NAME: humidity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: amount of water vapour in the air, at the time of sampling

FIELD.LABEL: conductivity
FIELD.NAME: conductivity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: electrical conductivity of water

FIELD.LABEL: solar irradiance
FIELD.NAME: solar irradiance
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: the amount of solar energy that arrives at a specific area of a surface during a specific time interval

FIELD.LABEL: wind direction
FIELD.NAME: wind direction
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: wind direction is the direction from which a wind originates

FIELD.LABEL: wind speed
FIELD.NAME: wind speed
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: speed of wind measured at the time of sampling

FIELD.LABEL: temperature
FIELD.NAME: temperature
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: temperature of the sample at time of sampling

FIELD.LABEL: turbidity
FIELD.NAME: turbidity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: turbidity measurement

FIELD.LABEL: pH
FIELD.NAME: pH
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: pH measurement

FIELD.LABEL: pH method
FIELD.NAME: pH method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: reference or method used in determining pH

FIELD.LABEL: fermentation vessel
FIELD.NAME: fermentation vessel
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The type of vessel used for containment of the fermentation.

FIELD.LABEL: fermentation headspace oxygen
FIELD.NAME: fermentation headspace oxygen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The amount of headspace oxygen in a fermentation vessel.

FIELD.LABEL: frequency of cleaning
FIELD.NAME: frequency of cleaning
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The number of times the sample location is cleaned. Frequency of cleaning might be on a Daily basis, Weekly, Monthly, Quarterly or Annually.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: concentration measurement

FIELD.LABEL: total organic carbon method
FIELD.NAME: total organic carbon method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Reference or method used in determining total organic carbon

FIELD.LABEL: air particulate matter concentration
FIELD.NAME: air particulate matter concentration
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Concentration of substances that remain suspended in the air, and comprise mixtures of organic and inorganic substances (PM10 and PM2.5); can report multiple PM's by entering numeric values preceded by name of PM

FIELD.LABEL: total nitrogen content method
FIELD.NAME: total nitrogen content method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Reference or method used in determining the total nitrogen

FIELD.LABEL: total nitrogen concentration
FIELD.NAME: total nitrogen concentration
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Concentration of nitrogen (total). Total nitrogen concentration of water samples, calculated by: total nitrogen = total dissolved nitrogen + particulate nitrogen. Can also be measured without filtering, reported as nitrogen

FIELD.LABEL: salinity
FIELD.NAME: salinity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The total concentration of all dissolved salts in a liquid or solid sample. While salinity can be measured by a complete chemical analysis, this method is difficult and time consuming. More often, it is instead derived from the conductivity measurement. This is known as practical salinity. These derivations compare the specific conductance of the sample to a salinity standard such as seawater.

FIELD.LABEL: total carbon
FIELD.NAME: total carbon
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: total carbon content

FIELD.LABEL: total organic carbon
FIELD.NAME: total organic carbon
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Definition for soil: total organic C content of the soil units of g C/kg soil. Definition otherwise: total organic carbon content

FIELD.LABEL: total nitrogen content
FIELD.NAME: total nitrogen content
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Total nitrogen content of the sample

FIELD.LABEL: water pH
FIELD.NAME: water pH
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: pH measurement of the sample, or liquid portion of sample, or aqueous phase of the fluid.

FIELD.LABEL: fermentation ph
FIELD.NAME: fermentation ph
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The pH of the fermented food fermentation process.

FIELD.LABEL: bacteria density
FIELD.NAME: bacteria density
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Number of bacteria in sample, as defined by bacteria density (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/GENEPIO_0000043).

FIELD.LABEL: salinity method
FIELD.NAME: salinity method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: reference or method used in determining salinity

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Pointer to physical material
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: References to sample or sample source material in physical resources

FIELD.LABEL: bio_material
FIELD.NAME: bio_material
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Unique identifier that references the biological material from which the sample was obtained and that ideally exists in a curated collection (e.g. stock centres, seed banks, DNA banks). The ID should have the following structure: name of the institution (institution code) followed by the collection code (if available) and the voucher id (institution_code:collection_code:voucher_id). Please note institution codes and collection codes are taken from a controlled vocabulary maintained by the INSDC: https://ftp.ncbi.nih.gov/pub/taxonomy/biocollections/

FIELD.LABEL: source material identifiers
FIELD.NAME: source material identifiers
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A unique identifier assigned to a material sample (as defined by http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/materialSampleID, and as opposed to a particular digital record of a material sample) used for extracting nucleic acids, and subsequent sequencing. The identifier can refer either to the original material collected or to any derived sub-samples. The INSDC qualifiers /specimen_voucher, /bio_material, or /culture_collection may or may not share the same value as the source_mat_id field. For instance, the /specimen_voucher qualifier and source_mat_id may both contain 'UAM:Herps:14' , referring to both the specimen voucher and sampled tissue with the same identifier. However, the /culture_collection qualifier may refer to a value from an initial culture (e.g. ATCC:11775) while source_mat_id would refer to an identifier from some derived culture from which the nucleic acids were extracted (e.g. xatc123 or ark:/2154/R2).

FIELD.LABEL: sample source material category
FIELD.NAME: sample source material category
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: This is the scientific role or category that the subject organism or material has with respect to an investigation. This field accepts terms listed under specimen source material category (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/GENEPIO_0001237 or http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/OBI_0100051).

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: local environment history

FIELD.LABEL: history/previous land use
FIELD.NAME: history/previous land use
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: previous land use and dates

FIELD.LABEL: history/crop rotation
FIELD.NAME: history/crop rotation
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: whether or not crop is rotated, and if yes, rotation schedule

FIELD.LABEL: history/tillage
FIELD.NAME: history/tillage
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: note method(s) used for tilling

FIELD.LABEL: mean seasonal humidity
FIELD.NAME: mean seasonal humidity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Average humidity of the region throughout the growing season.

FIELD.LABEL: mean seasonal temperature
FIELD.NAME: mean seasonal temperature
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Mean seasonal temperature

FIELD.LABEL: mean seasonal precipitation
FIELD.NAME: mean seasonal precipitation
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The average of all seasonal precipitation values known, or an estimated equivalent value derived by such methods as regional indexes or Isohyetal maps.

FIELD.LABEL: extreme weather date
FIELD.NAME: extreme weather date
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Date of unusual weather events that may have affected microbial populations. Multiple terms can be separated by pipes, listed in reverse chronological order.

FIELD.LABEL: extreme weather event
FIELD.NAME: extreme weather event
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Unusual weather events that may have affected microbial populations. Multiple terms can be separated by pipes, listed in reverse chronological order.

FIELD.LABEL: season
FIELD.NAME: season
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The season when sampling occurred. Any of the four periods into which the year is divided by the equinoxes and solstices. This field accepts terms listed under season (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C94729).

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: host details

FIELD.LABEL: host genotype
FIELD.NAME: host genotype
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: observed genotype

FIELD.LABEL: host specificity or range
FIELD.NAME: host specificity or range
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The range and diversity of host species that an organism is capable of infecting, defined by NCBI taxonomy identifier.

FIELD.LABEL: host dry mass
FIELD.NAME: host dry mass
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: measurement of dry mass

FIELD.LABEL: host prediction approach
FIELD.NAME: host prediction approach
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Tool or approach used for host prediction

FIELD.LABEL: host prediction estimated accuracy
FIELD.NAME: host prediction estimated accuracy
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: For each tool or approach used for host prediction, estimated false discovery rates should be included, either computed de novo or from the literature

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: treatment
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: Details of a treatment regime with a treatment agent.

FIELD.LABEL: spike-in microbial strain
FIELD.NAME: spike-in microbial strain
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Taxonomic information about the spike-in organism(s) at the strain level. This field accepts terms under organism (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C14250). This field also accepts identification numbers from NCBI under https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/taxonomy. Multiple terms can be separated by pipes.

FIELD.LABEL: fermentation chemical additives
FIELD.NAME: fermentation chemical additives
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Any chemicals that are added to the fermentation process to achieve the desired final product.

FIELD.LABEL: fermentation chemical additives percentage
FIELD.NAME: fermentation chemical additives percentage
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The amount of chemical added to the fermentation process.

FIELD.LABEL: study treatment
FIELD.NAME: study treatment
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A process in which the act is intended to modify or alter some other material entity. From the study design, each treatment is comprised of one level of one or multiple factors. This field accepts terms listed under treatment (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/MCO_0000866). If the proper descriptor is not listed please use text to describe the study treatment. Multiple terms can be separated by one or more pipes.

FIELD.LABEL: spike-in organism
FIELD.NAME: spike-in organism
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Taxonomic information about the spike-in organism(s). This field accepts terms under organism (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C14250). This field also accepts identification numbers from NCBI under https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/taxonomy. Multiple terms can be separated by pipes.

FIELD.LABEL: spike-in organism count
FIELD.NAME: spike-in organism count
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Total cell count of any organism (or group of organisms) per gram, volume or area of sample, should include name of organism followed by count. The method that was used for the enumeration (e.g. qPCR, atp, mpn, etc.) should also be provided (example: total prokaryotes; 3.5e7 cells per ml; qPCR).

FIELD.LABEL: fermentation temperature
FIELD.NAME: fermentation temperature
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The temperature of the fermented food fermentation process.

FIELD.LABEL: spike-in with heavy metals
FIELD.NAME: spike-in with heavy metals
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Heavy metals used in research study to assess effects of exposure on microbiome of a specific site. Please list heavy metals and concentration used for spike-in.

FIELD.LABEL: microbial starter inoculation
FIELD.NAME: microbial starter inoculation
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The amount of starter culture used to inoculate a new batch.

FIELD.LABEL: microbial starter source
FIELD.NAME: microbial starter source
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The source from which the microbial starter culture was sourced. If commercially supplied, list supplier.

FIELD.LABEL: microbial starter preparation
FIELD.NAME: microbial starter preparation
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Information about the protocol or method used to prepare the starter inoculum.

FIELD.LABEL: spike-in bacterial serovar or serotype
FIELD.NAME: spike-in bacterial serovar or serotype
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Taxonomic information about the spike-in organism(s) at the serovar or serotype level. This field accepts terms under organism (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C14250). This field also accepts identification numbers from NCBI under https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/taxonomy. Multiple terms can be separated by pipes.

FIELD.LABEL: antimicrobial phenotype of spike-in bacteria
FIELD.NAME: antimicrobial phenotype of spike-in bacteria
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Qualitative description of a microbial response to antimicrobial agents. Bacteria may be susceptible or resistant to a broad range of antibiotic drugs or drug classes, with several intermediate states or phases. This field accepts terms under antimicrobial phenotype (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ARO_3004299).

FIELD.LABEL: fermentation time
FIELD.NAME: fermentation time
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The time duration of the fermented food fermentation process.

FIELD.LABEL: microbial starter organism count
FIELD.NAME: microbial starter organism count
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Total cell count of starter culture per gram, volume or area of sample and the method that was used for the enumeration (e.g. qPCR, atp, mpn, etc.) should also be provided. (example : total prokaryotes; 3.5e7 cells per ml; qPCR).

FIELD.LABEL: spike-in with antibiotics
FIELD.NAME: spike-in with antibiotics
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Antimicrobials used in research study to assess effects of exposure on microbiome of a specific site. Please list antimicrobial, common name and/or class and concentration used for spike-in.

FIELD.LABEL: study incubation temperature
FIELD.NAME: study incubation temperature
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Sample incubation temperature if unpublished or unvalidated method is used.

FIELD.LABEL: perturbation
FIELD.NAME: perturbation
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: type of perturbation, e.g. chemical administration, physical disturbance, etc., coupled with time that perturbation occurred; can include multiple perturbation types

FIELD.LABEL: study incubation duration
FIELD.NAME: study incubation duration
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Sample incubation duration if unpublished or unvalidated method is used. Indicate the timepoint written in ISO 8601 format.

FIELD.LABEL: biocide
FIELD.NAME: biocide
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Substance intended for preventing, neutralizing, destroying, repelling, or mitigating the effects of any pest or microorganism; that inhibits the growth, reproduction, and activity of organisms, including fungal cells; decreases the number of fungi or pests present; deters microbial growth and degradation of other ingredients in the formulation. Indicate the biocide used on the location where the sample was taken. Multiple terms can be separated by pipes.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: experimental factor and block

FIELD.LABEL: negative control type
FIELD.NAME: negative control type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The substance or equipment used as a negative control in an investigation

FIELD.LABEL: positive control type
FIELD.NAME: positive control type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The substance, mixture, product, or apparatus used to verify that a process which is part of an investigation delivers a true positive.

FIELD.LABEL: experimental factor
FIELD.NAME: experimental factor
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Experimental factors are essentially the variable aspects of an experiment design which can be used to describe an experiment, or set of experiments, in an increasingly detailed manner. This field accepts ontology terms from Experimental Factor Ontology (EFO) and/or Ontology for Biomedical Investigations (OBI). For a browser of EFO (v 2.95) terms, please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/EFO; for a browser of OBI (v 2018-02-12) terms please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/OBI. E.g. time series design [EFO:EFO_0001779]

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Organism characteristics: genetic
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: The genetic based characteristics of organisms (Organism characteristics field group became too large)

FIELD.LABEL: encoded traits
FIELD.NAME: encoded traits
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Should include key traits like antibiotic resistance or xenobiotic degradation phenotypes for plasmids, converting genes for phage

FIELD.LABEL: genetic modification
FIELD.NAME: genetic modification
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A genetic modification of the genome of an organism which may occur naturally by spontaneous mutation, or be introduced by some experimental means. Examples of genetic modification include specification of a transgene or the gene knocked-out or details of transient transfection.

FIELD.LABEL: subspecific genetic lineage
FIELD.NAME: subspecific genetic lineage
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Information about the genetic distinctness of the sequenced organism below the subspecies level, e.g., serovar, serotype, biotype, ecotype, or any relevant genetic typing schemes like Group I plasmid. Subspecies should not be recorded in this term, but in the NCBI taxonomy. Supply both the lineage name and the lineage rank separated by a colon, e.g., biovar:abc123.

FIELD.LABEL: ancestral data
FIELD.NAME: ancestral data
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: information about either pedigree or other description of ancestral information (e.g. parental variety in case of mutant or selection), e.g. A/3*B (meaning [(A x B) x B] x B)

FIELD.LABEL: taxonomic classification
FIELD.NAME: taxonomic classification
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Method used for taxonomic classification, along with reference database used, classification rank, and thresholds used to classify new genomes. Expected values are: classification method, database name, and other parameters e.g. vConTACT vContact2 (references from NCBI RefSeq v83, genus rank classification, default parameters)

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: growth medium
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: specification of the substance where a plant sample has been grown

FIELD.LABEL: plant growth medium
FIELD.NAME: plant growth medium
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Specification of the media for growing the plants or tissue cultured samples, e.g. soil, aeroponic, hydroponic, in vitro solid culture medium, in vitro liquid culture medium. Recommended value is a specific value from EO:plant growth medium (follow this link for terms http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/EO_0007147).

FIELD.LABEL: rooting conditions
FIELD.NAME: rooting conditions
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: relevant rooting conditions, such as field plot size, sowing density, container dimensions, number of plants per container

FIELD.LABEL: rooting medium macronutrients
FIELD.NAME: rooting medium macronutrients
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: measurement of the culture rooting medium macronutrients (N,P, K, Ca, Mg, S); e.g. KH2PO4 (170mg/L)

FIELD.LABEL: rooting medium micronutrients
FIELD.NAME: rooting medium micronutrients
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: measurement of the culture rooting medium micronutrients (Fe, Mn, Zn, B, Cu, Mo); e.g. H3BO3 (6.2mg/L)

FIELD.LABEL: rooting medium carbon
FIELD.NAME: rooting medium carbon
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: source of organic carbon in the culture rooting medium; e.g. sucrose

FIELD.LABEL: rooting medium pH
FIELD.NAME: rooting medium pH
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: pH measurement of the culture rooting medium; e.g. 5.5

FIELD.LABEL: microbiological culture medium
FIELD.NAME: microbiological culture medium
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A culture medium used to select for, grow, and maintain prokaryotic microorganisms. Can be in either liquid (broth) or solidified (e.g. with agar) forms. This field accepts terms listed under microbiological culture medium (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/MICRO_0000067). If the proper descriptor is not listed please use text to describe the culture medium.

FIELD.LABEL: spike-in growth medium
FIELD.NAME: spike-in growth medium
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A liquid or gel containing nutrients, salts, and other factors formulated to support the growth of microorganisms, cells, or plants (National Cancer Institute Thesaurus). A growth medium is a culture medium which has the disposition to encourage growth of particular bacteria to the exclusion of others in the same growth environment. In this case, list the culture medium used to propagate the spike-in bacteria during preparation of spike-in inoculum. This field accepts terms listed under microbiological culture medium (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/MICRO_0000067). If the proper descriptor is not listed please use text to describe the spike in growth media.

FIELD.LABEL: fermentation medium
FIELD.NAME: fermentation medium
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The growth medium used for the fermented food fermentation process, which supplies the required nutrients. Usually this includes a carbon and nitrogen source, water, micronutrients and chemical additives.

FIELD.LABEL: growth medium
FIELD.NAME: growth medium
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A liquid or gel containing nutrients, salts, and other factors formulated to support the growth of microorganisms, cells, or plants (National Cancer Institute Thesaurus). The name of the medium used to grow the microorganism.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Reference

FIELD.LABEL: isolation and growth condition
FIELD.NAME: isolation and growth condition
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Publication reference in the form of pubmed ID (pmid), digital object identifier (doi) or url for isolation and growth condition specifications of the organism/material. Mandatory for MIGS and MIMARKS Specimen.

FIELD.LABEL: annotation source
FIELD.NAME: annotation source
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: For cases where annotation was provided by a community jamboree or model organism database rather than by a specific submitter

FIELD.LABEL: reference for biomaterial
FIELD.NAME: reference for biomaterial
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Primary publication if isolated before genome publication; otherwise, primary genome report. Mandatory for MIGS of bacteria and archaea.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: sample processing
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: Any aspects collected about the processing of the sample once it has been collected. if the sample underwent cell lysis.

FIELD.LABEL: sequencing location
FIELD.NAME: sequencing location
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The location the sequencing run was performed. Indicate the name of the lab or core facility where samples were sequenced.

FIELD.LABEL: enrichment protocol
FIELD.NAME: enrichment protocol
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The microbiological workflow or protocol followed to test for the presence or enumeration of the target microbial analyte(s). Please provide a PubMed or DOI reference for published protocols.

FIELD.LABEL: library preparation kit
FIELD.NAME: library preparation kit
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Packaged kits (containing adapters, indexes, enzymes, buffers etc.), tailored for specific sequencing workflows, which allow the simplified preparation of sequencing-ready libraries for small genomes, amplicons, and plasmids.

FIELD.LABEL: nucleic acid extraction kit
FIELD.NAME: nucleic acid extraction kit
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The name of the extraction kit used to recover the nucleic acid fraction of an input material is performed.

FIELD.LABEL: sample pooling
FIELD.NAME: sample pooling
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Physical combination of several instances of like material, e.g. RNA extracted from samples or dishes of cell cultures into one big aliquot of cells. Please provide a short description of the samples that were pooled.

FIELD.LABEL: lot number
FIELD.NAME: lot number
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A distinctive alpha-numeric identification code assigned by the manufacturer or distributor to a specific quantity of manufactured material or product within a batch. Synonym: Batch Number. The submitter should provide lot number of the item followed by the item name for which the lot number was provided.

FIELD.LABEL: single cell or viral particle lysis approach
FIELD.NAME: single cell or viral particle lysis approach
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Method used to free DNA from interior of the cell(s) or particle(s)

FIELD.LABEL: single cell or viral particle lysis kit protocol
FIELD.NAME: single cell or viral particle lysis kit protocol
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the kit or standard protocol used for cell(s) or particle(s) lysis

FIELD.LABEL: pooled DNA extract total
FIELD.NAME: pooled DNA extract total
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Indicate whether multiple DNA extractions were mixed. If the answer yes, the number of extracts that were pooled should be given. [ENA version of MIxS term: pooling of DNA extracts (if done). ]

FIELD.LABEL: sample material processing
FIELD.NAME: sample material processing
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A brief description of any processing applied to the sample during or after retrieving the sample from environment, or a link to the relevant protocol(s) performed.

FIELD.LABEL: sample volume or weight for DNA extraction
FIELD.NAME: sample volume or weight for DNA extraction
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Volume (ml) or mass (g) of total collected sample processed for DNA extraction. Note: total sample collected should be entered under the term 'sample size'.

FIELD.LABEL: nucleic acid extraction
FIELD.NAME: nucleic acid extraction
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A link to a literature reference, electronic resource or a standard operating procedure (SOP), that describes the material separation to recover the nucleic acid fraction from a sample

FIELD.LABEL: nucleic acid amplification
FIELD.NAME: nucleic acid amplification
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A link to a literature reference, electronic resource or a standard operating procedure (SOP), that describes the enzymatic amplification (PCR, TMA, NASBA) of specific nucleic acids

FIELD.LABEL: library size
FIELD.NAME: library size
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Total number of clones in the library prepared for the project

FIELD.LABEL: library reads sequenced
FIELD.NAME: library reads sequenced
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Total number of clones sequenced from the library

FIELD.LABEL: library vector
FIELD.NAME: library vector
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Cloning vector type(s) used in construction of libraries

FIELD.LABEL: library screening strategy
FIELD.NAME: library screening strategy
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Specific enrichment or screening methods applied before and/or after creating clone libraries in order to select a specific group of sequences

FIELD.LABEL: pcr conditions
FIELD.NAME: pcr conditions
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Description of reaction conditions and components for PCR in the form of 'initial denaturation:94degC_1.5min; annealing=...'

FIELD.LABEL: assembly software
FIELD.NAME: assembly software
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Tool(s) used for assembly, including version number and parameters in the format {software};{version};{parameters} e.g. metaSPAdes;3.11.0;kmer set 21,33,55,77,99,121, default parameters otherwise

FIELD.LABEL: pcr primers
FIELD.NAME: pcr primers
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: PCR primers that were used to amplify the sequence of the targeted gene, locus or subfragment. This field should contain all the primers used for a single PCR reaction if multiple forward or reverse primers are present in a single PCR reaction. The primer sequence should be reported in uppercase letters

FIELD.LABEL: adapters
FIELD.NAME: adapters
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Adapters provide priming sequences for both amplification and sequencing of the sample-library fragments. Both adapters should be reported; in uppercase letters

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: food and agriculture
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: food related from yield to food production, to agricultural machinery.

FIELD.LABEL: food animal antimicrobial
FIELD.NAME: food animal antimicrobial
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The name(s) (generic or brand) of the antimicrobial(s) given to the food animal within the last 30 days.

FIELD.LABEL: food shipping transportation vehicle
FIELD.NAME: food shipping transportation vehicle
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A descriptor for the mobile machine which is used to transport food commodities along the food distribution system. This field accepts terms listed under vehicle (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_01000604). If the proper descrptor is not listed please use text to describe the mode of travel. Multiple terms can be separated by one or more pipes.

FIELD.LABEL: water source shared
FIELD.NAME: water source shared
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Other users sharing access to the same water source. Multiple terms can be separated by one or more pipes.

FIELD.LABEL: food source
FIELD.NAME: food source
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Type of plant or animal from which the food product or its major ingredient is derived or a chemical food source [FDA CFSAN 1995].

FIELD.LABEL: food shipping transportation method
FIELD.NAME: food shipping transportation method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A descriptor for the method of movement of food commodity along the food distribution system. This field accepts terms listed under travel mode (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/GENEPIO_0001064). If the proper descrptor is not listed please use text to describe the mode of travel. Multiple terms can be separated by one or more pipes.

FIELD.LABEL: material of contact prior to food packaging
FIELD.NAME: material of contact prior to food packaging
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The material the food contacted (e.g., was processed in) prior to packaging. This field accepts terms listed under material of contact prior to food packaging (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03530077). If the proper descriptor is not listed please use text to describe the material of contact prior to food packaging.

FIELD.LABEL: food product name legal status
FIELD.NAME: food product name legal status
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A datum indicating that use of a food product name is regulated in some legal jurisdiction. This field accepts terms listed under food product name legal status (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03530087).

FIELD.LABEL: food quality date
FIELD.NAME: food quality date
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The date recommended for the use of the product while at peak quality, this date is not a reflection of safety unless used on infant formula this date is not a reflection of safety and is typically labeled on a food product as "best if used by," best by," "use by," or "freeze by."

FIELD.LABEL: food cleaning process
FIELD.NAME: food cleaning process
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The process of cleaning food to separate other environmental materials from the food source. Multiple terms can be separated by pipes.

FIELD.LABEL: hygienic food production area
FIELD.NAME: hygienic food production area
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The subdivision of areas within a food production facility according to hygienic requirements. This field accepts terms listed under hygienic food production area (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO). Please add a term that most accurately indicates the hygienic area your sample was taken from according to the definitions provided.

FIELD.LABEL: food contact surface
FIELD.NAME: food contact surface
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The specific container or coating materials in direct contact with the food. Multiple values can be assigned. This field accepts terms listed under food contact surface (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03500010).

FIELD.LABEL: food cooking process
FIELD.NAME: food cooking process
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The transformation of raw food by the application of heat. This field accepts terms listed under food cooking (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03450002).

FIELD.LABEL: food product by quality
FIELD.NAME: food product by quality
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Descriptors for describing food visually or via other senses, which is useful for tasks like food inspection where little prior knowledge of how the food came to be is available. Some terms like "food (frozen)" are both a quality descriptor and the output of a process. This field accepts terms listed under food product by quality (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_00002454).

FIELD.LABEL: food animal antimicrobial route of administration
FIELD.NAME: food animal antimicrobial route of administration
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The route by which the antimicrobial is administered into the body of the food animal.

FIELD.LABEL: food allergen labeling
FIELD.NAME: food allergen labeling
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A label indication that the product contains a recognized allergen. This field accepts terms listed under dietary claim or use (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03510213).

FIELD.LABEL: food product type
FIELD.NAME: food product type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A food product type is a class of food products that is differentiated by its food composition (e.g., single- or multi-ingredient), processing and/or consumption characteristics. This does not include brand name products but it may include generic food dish categories. This field accepts terms under food product type (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON:03400361). For terms related to food product for an animal, consult food product for animal (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03309997). If the proper descriptor is not listed please use text to describe the food type. Multiple terms can be separated by one or more pipes.

FIELD.LABEL: food animal source sex category
FIELD.NAME: food animal source sex category
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The sex and reproductive status of the food animal.

FIELD.LABEL: animal intrusion near sample source
FIELD.NAME: animal intrusion near sample source
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Identification of animals intruding on the sample or sample site including invertebrates (such as pests or pollinators) and vertebrates (such as wildlife or domesticated animals). This field accepts terms under organism (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C14250). This field also accepts identification numbers from NCBI under https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/taxonomy. Multiple terms can be separated by pipes.

FIELD.LABEL: food packing medium integrity
FIELD.NAME: food packing medium integrity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A term label and term id to describe the state of the packing material and text to explain the exact condition. This field accepts terms listed under food packing medium integrity (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03530218).

FIELD.LABEL: microbial starter
FIELD.NAME: microbial starter
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Any type of microorganisms used in food production. This field accepts terms listed under live organisms for food production (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_0344453).

FIELD.LABEL: food treatment process
FIELD.NAME: food treatment process
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Used to specifically characterize a food product based on the treatment or processes applied to the product or any indexed ingredient. The processes include adding, substituting or removing components or modifying the food or component, e.g., through fermentation. Multiple values can be assigned. This fields accepts terms listed under food treatment process (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03460111).

FIELD.LABEL: food preservation process
FIELD.NAME: food preservation process
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The methods contributing to the prevention or retardation of microbial, enzymatic or oxidative spoilage and thus to the extension of shelf life. This field accepts terms listed under food preservation process (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03470107).

FIELD.LABEL: microbial starter ncbi taxonomy id
FIELD.NAME: microbial starter ncbi taxonomy id
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Please include Genus species and strain ID, if known of microorganisms used in food production. For complex communities, pipes can be used to separate two or more microbes.

FIELD.LABEL: interagency food safety analytics collaboration (ifsac) category
FIELD.SYNONYM: Interagency Food Safety Analytics Collaboration (IFSAC) category
FIELD.NAME: interagency food safety analytics collaboration (ifsac) category
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The IFSAC food categorization scheme has five distinct levels to which foods can be assigned, depending upon the type of food. First, foods are assigned to one of four food groups (aquatic animals, land animals, plants, and other). Food groups include increasingly specific food categories; dairy, eggs, meat and poultry, and game are in the land animal food group, and the category meat and poultry is further subdivided into more specific categories of meat (beef, pork, other meat) and poultry (chicken, turkey, other poultry). Finally, foods are differentiated by differences in food processing (such as pasteurized fluid dairy products, unpasteurized fluid dairy products, pasteurized solid and semi-solid dairy products, and unpasteurized solid and semi-solid dairy products. An IFSAC food category chart is available from https://www.cdc.gov/foodsafety/ifsac/projects/food-categorization-scheme.html PMID: 28926300.

FIELD.LABEL: food animal body condition
FIELD.NAME: food animal body condition
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Body condition scoring is a production management tool used to evaluate overall health and nutritional needs of a food animal. Because there are different scoring systems, this field is restricted to three categories.

FIELD.LABEL: food product synonym
FIELD.NAME: food product synonym
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Other names by which the food product is known by (e.g., regional or non-English names).

FIELD.LABEL: food ingredient
FIELD.NAME: food ingredient
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: In this field, please list individual ingredients for multi-component food [FOODON:00002501] and simple foods that is not captured in food_type. Please use terms that are present in FoodOn. Multiple terms can be separated by one or more pipes |, but please consider limiting this list to the top 5 ingredients listed in order as on the food label. See also, https://www.fda.gov/food/food-ingredients-packaging/overview-food-ingredients-additives-colors.

FIELD.LABEL: food stored by consumer (storage duration)
FIELD.NAME: food stored by consumer (storage duration)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The storage duration of the food commodity by the consumer, prior to onset of illness or sample collection. Indicate the timepoint written in ISO 8601 format.

FIELD.LABEL: food animal antimicrobial duration
FIELD.NAME: food animal antimicrobial duration
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The duration of time (days) that the antimicrobial was administered to the food animal.

FIELD.LABEL: part of plant or animal
FIELD.NAME: part of plant or animal
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The anatomical part of the organism being involved in food production or consumption; e.g., a carrot is the root of the plant (root vegetable). This field accepts terms listed under part of plant or animal (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03420116).

FIELD.LABEL: hazard analysis critical control points (haccp) guide food safety term
FIELD.SYNONYM: Hazard Analysis Critical Control Points (HACCP) guide food safety term
azard Analysis Critical Control Points (HACCP) guide food safety term
FIELD.NAME: hazard analysis critical control points (haccp) guide food safety term
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Hazard Analysis Critical Control Points (HACCP) food safety terms; This field accepts terms listed under HACCP guide food safety term (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03530221).

FIELD.LABEL: dietary claim or use
FIELD.NAME: dietary claim or use
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: These descriptors are used either for foods intended for special dietary use as defined in 21 CFR 105 or for foods that have special characteristics indicated in the name or labeling. This field accepts terms listed under dietary claim or use (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03510023). Multiple terms can be separated by one or more pipes, but please consider limiting this list to the most prominent dietary claim or use.

FIELD.LABEL: degree of plant part maturity
FIELD.NAME: degree of plant part maturity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A description of the stage of development of a plant or plant part based on maturity or ripeness. This field accepts terms listed under degree of plant maturity (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03530050).

FIELD.LABEL: food production environmental monitoring zone
FIELD.NAME: food production environmental monitoring zone
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: An environmental monitoring zone is a formal designation as part of an environmental monitoring program, in which areas of a food production facility are categorized, commonly as zones 1-4, based on likelihood or risk of foodborne pathogen contamination. This field accepts terms listed under food production environmental monitoring zone (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO). Please add a term to indicate the environmental monitoring zone the sample was taken from.

FIELD.LABEL: plant reproductive part
FIELD.NAME: plant reproductive part
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Plant reproductive part used in the field during planting to start the crop.

FIELD.LABEL: food traceability list category
FIELD.NAME: food traceability list category
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The FDA is proposing to establish additional traceability recordkeeping requirements (beyond what is already required in existing regulations) for persons who manufacture, process, pack, or hold foods the Agency has designated for inclusion on the Food Traceability List. The Food Traceability List (FTL) identifies the foods for which the additional traceability records described in the proposed rule would be required. The term “Food Traceability List” (FTL) refers not only to the foods specifically listed (https://www.fda.gov/media/142303/download), but also to any foods that contain listed foods as ingredients.

FIELD.LABEL: food animal antimicrobial frequency
FIELD.NAME: food animal antimicrobial frequency
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The frequency per day that the antimicrobial was administered to the food animal.

FIELD.LABEL: intended consumer
FIELD.NAME: intended consumer
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Food consumer type, human or animal, for which the food product is produced and marketed. This field accepts terms listed under food consumer group (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03510136) or NCBI taxid.

FIELD.LABEL: quantity purchased
FIELD.NAME: quantity purchased
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The quantity of food purchased by consumer.

FIELD.LABEL: food container or wrapping
FIELD.NAME: food container or wrapping
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Type of container or wrapping defined by the main container material, the container form, and the material of the liner lids or ends. Also type of container or wrapping by form; prefer description by material first, then by form. This field accepts terms listed under food container or wrapping (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03490100).

FIELD.LABEL: food additive
FIELD.NAME: food additive
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A substance or substances added to food to maintain or improve safety and freshness, to improve or maintain nutritional value, or improve taste, texture and appearance. This field accepts terms listed under food additive (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03412972). Multiple terms can be separated by one or more pipes, but please consider limiting this list to the top 5 ingredients listed in order as on the food label. See also, https://www.fda.gov/food/food-ingredients-packaging/overview-food-ingredients-additives-colors.

FIELD.LABEL: food source age
FIELD.NAME: food source age
